channel.title: Changin Start Button Text [Untested, found on Windows XP SP2]
channel.description:
This is my own way I've just found out how to do by looking around at explorer.exe's shit from ResHacker.This is my own way I've just found out how to do by looking around at explorer.exe's shit from ResHacker.
Download ResHacker from here if you haven't : [url=http://www.angusj.com/resourcehacker/]Here[/url]
Extract the .RAR and start up ResHacker.exe. Once there, click File and then Open. Navigate your way to the [MAIN HARDDRIVE - FOR ME ITS C:]\WINDOWS folder. Look for [code]explorer.exe[/code]. Open it up. Go to the String folder icon and open it up from the box with the '+' in it in ResHacker once you've opened explorer.exe. Go to the folder [code]37[/code], and open it up from the box with the '+' in it. Select the crank-thing icon with 1033 after it and look at the textbox on the other panel. For me, it's: [code] STRINGTABLE LANGUAGE LANG_ENGLISH, SUBLANG_ENGLISH_US { 578, "start" 579, "There was an internal error and one of the windows you were using has been closed." 580, "Restrictions" 581, "This operation has been cancelled due to restrictions in effect on this computer. Please contact your system administrator." 590, "Hiding your inactive notification icons..." 591, "To see the hidden icons, click this button." }[/code] Edit the [code]start[/code] to anything, like lets say, [code]hello[/code]. Then click the button above it called "Compile Script".
[B]UNTESTED! IF YOU GET A MESSED UP COMPUTER DON'T BLAME ME![/B]

item.title: Changin Start Button Text [Untested, found on Windows XP SP2]
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

Just doing that will not work. I’ve done this before w/ reshacker. You also have to go into your registry and edit a value in it to load your version, which I really don’t recommend you go messing around your reigsty if you don’t know what your doing…you can also edit the info boxes that pop up when you hold your mouse over something in the start menu like My Computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Changin Start Button Text [Untested, found on Windows XP SP2]
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

This is my own way I’ve just found out how to do by looking around at explorer.exe’s shit from ResHacker.This is my own way I’ve just found out how to do by looking around at explorer.exe’s shit from ResHacker.

Download ResHacker from here if you haven’t : Here

Extract the .RAR and start up ResHacker.exe.
Once there, click File and then Open.
Navigate your way to the [MAIN HARDDRIVE - FOR ME ITS C:]\WINDOWS folder.
Look for explorer.exe.
Open it up.
Go to the String folder icon and open it up from the box with the ‘+’ in it in ResHacker once you’ve opened explorer.exe.
Go to the folder 37, and open it up from the box with the ‘+’ in it.
Select the crank-thing icon with 1033 after it and look at the textbox on the other panel.
For me, it’s:

STRINGTABLE LANGUAGE LANG_ENGLISH, SUBLANG_ENGLISH_US { 578, "start" 579, "There was an internal error and one of the windows you were using has been closed." 580, "Restrictions" 581, "This operation has been cancelled due to restrictions in effect on this computer. Please contact your system administrator." 590, "Hiding your inactive notification icons..." 591, "To see the hidden icons, click this button." }
Edit the start to anything, like lets say, hello. Then click the button above it called “Compile Script”.

UNTESTED! IF YOU GET A MESSED UP COMPUTER DON’T BLAME ME!

Read full topic
